title: Dear Bard players who start W

replies.body:
That's why I want him to be an actually useful champion =\
though, as a {{champion:16}} main, I'd like to point out that if my jungler is near bot lane, I always wait in-between them and their next camp (outside of exp range) and heal them to full after they finish the first camp. My adc is fine for 10 seconds alone =P

adc: /all Report this shit soraka!
soraka: why?
adc: fucking left me alone in lane if i fucking die it's your fuckin fault

# #bronzelife #adc=angrydoucheycunt

Thankfully, that doesn't happen to me!
Often...
They tend to change their tune once I save their lives 20 times.
Usually...
Tried soraka with my friends recently, I literally made their last 10% of their health more than the rest. It's so easy to bait enemies with it.
There's nothing better than a bad team not focusing you as Soraka while you heal your entire team.
People always underestimate the unicorn.

It's really sad to see ADCs complaining about a support roaming or something. As an MF main it really creates a bad stereotype. Personally I don't care if my support roams, probably because it's like 50% of the reason why supports exist lol

> [{quoted}](name=Drackolus,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=xPm7ojgV,comment-id=0003,timestamp=2015-04-13T23:28:42.080+0000)
>
> That's why I want him to be an actually useful champion =\
> though, as a {{champion:16}} main, I'd like to point out that if my jungler is near bot lane, I always wait in-between them and their next camp (outside of exp range) and heal them to full after they finish the first camp. My adc is fine for 10 seconds alone =P

Even when you are in a hurry, one heal right before you run off to lane can **seriously** improve your junglers clear, especially with assassin/carry junglers who struggle with sustain.
That's exactly why I do it. Us supports and junglers, we know the struggle from the abuse of solo laners. We gotta stick together.

Junglers having an incentive to visit us doesn't hurt either.

Not that we're bribing them, of course.
he is a useful champ, just lacks any real power to feel like you contribute damage wise.

His problem is that his laning phase is so atrocious that he can't afford to roam. Supports can really only roam usefully when the enemy laners are pushed out, and he has absolutely no ability to apply or prevent pressure. When he's there, it's a 2v1.5, and so roaming will always be a ba(r)d idea.

Maybe this is Bard's calling... a support that can assist more than one lane (inc. jungle) in the laning phase. Pair him with an ADC that can stall a lane well, and while you do sacrifice the ADC's ability to hypercarry/snowball, you get overall better team performance.
It's almost like he was designed to be a roaming support. ... odd.

Giving all 3 shrines to jungler is effectively removing 1 camp worth of damage. And when some junglers have to back after only 3 or 4 camps, that is huge. Never mind if they have to face a strong counter-jungler (like Shaco).

And this is why Bard is OP.

At level 1 that's pretty good.

It's also amazing when they leave them for laners too.

Seriously, a Bard yesterday helped me get a kill top (And he got an Assist too I think) because he left a shrine at my tower. He also left one by Gromp for the jungler and at mid tower.

Good guy Bard, ftw.
Then my ADC walks over them and I just stand there staring at the screen with utter rage.

There's absolutely no reason not to grab W first as Bard. I usually put 2 shrines in jungle and 1 shrine in mid, then by the time we start laning bot, the jungle ones are taken so I can put 2 in bot. And the first 3 chimes negate most of the mana loss.
Plus the fact hat you can totally back after placing 3 shrines
Very true, but honestly I never found myself needing to, even with the old chime mana formula (15 + 8% missing).
